## Summary

Fixes BUG-004: "database is locked" error when saving todos in the TUI, particularly in Docker environments with bind mounts.

## Problem

When saving a todo in the TUI, users encountered `SQLite.SQLiteException\("database is locked"\)`. This occurred due to:
1. SQLite''s default `busy_timeout` of 0ms \(fails immediately on any lock\)
2. Docker bind mount limitations on Windows hosts where file locking doesn''t work reliably

## Solution

Updated `connect_database\(\)` in `src/database.jl` to set two PRAGMA settings:
- **`busy_timeout = 5000`**: Wait up to 5 seconds for locks to be released
- **`journal_mode = WAL`**: Enable Write-Ahead Logging for better concurrency \(file DBs only\)

## Changes

- `src/database.jl`: Added PRAGMA settings in `connect_database\(\)` function
- `docs/bugs/tui-bugs.md`: Updated BUG-004 status to FIXED with root cause analysis

## Testing

- [x] All tests pass \(960/960 tests\)
- [x] Verified PRAGMA settings are applied correctly
- [x] Verified in-memory databases don''t get WAL mode \(uses memory journal\)
- [x] Manual testing in Docker - all operations work without lock errors
